info.title: An API for SpatioTemporal Asset Catalogs
info.description: The SpatioTemporal Asset Catalog specification aims to standardize the way geospatial assets are exposed online and queried.  A 'spatiotemporal asset' is any file that represents information about the earth captured in a certain space and time. Most of the initial  use cases are related to imagery, but the api is designed to enable search of any spatiotemporal data items. SpatioTemporal Asset Catalogs  can be completely static, implemented as flat files on the web that can be crawled. This API has the same responses as a static catalog, but also offers querying capabilities in addition to exposing data online. This API was inspired by WFS 3.0, and the goal is to make it compatible with that specification.

200.description: The formal documentation of this API according to the OpenAPI specification, version 3.0. I.e., this document.
Successful response containing a FeatureCollection of items across all indexes.

get.summary: Retrieve STAC compliant Items matching filters
get.description: Returns a pageable GeoJSON feature collection of the Items matching the query

post.summary: Accepts a JSON representation of the query parameters to seach and produce an ItemCollection

200.description: Returns a pageable GeoJSON feature collection of the items matching the query

put.summary: Adds one or more items to the catalog
put.description: The request body may contain either a single item in JSON format or an array of items.

200.description: Returns a JSON response with the success status

404.description: The item with id {id} does not exist.
The item with id {id} does not exist.
The item with id {id} does not exist.

tags.name: Capabilities
tags.description: Essential characteristics of this API including information about the data.

next.name: next
next.description: Token for the next set of paginated data.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Defines the maximum number or results retruned by the API

time.name: time
time.description: An array of date-time strings that adheres to RFC3339 (for example 1985-04-12T23:20:50.52Z). One date-time in the array is the time to match. Two date-times represent a range. Any additional items in the array will be ignored.

bbox.name: bbox
bbox.description:
Only items that have a geometry that intersects the bounding box are selected. The bounding box is provided as four numbers, in longitude & latitude:
* West, South, East, North

filter.name: filter
filter.description: A CQL string based off of GeoTools CQL language

propertyname.name: propertyname
propertyname.description: A comma separated list of property names to be returned in the JSON response

AcceptHeader.name: Accept
AcceptHeader.description: Setting the Accept header value to 'text/event-stream' enables Server-Sent Events. Instead of returning a single ItemCollection, each Item will be streamed back from the server as they become available.

bbox.description: Array of doubles in order of minx, miny, maxx, maxy

limit.description: An integer limiting the number of records to be returned.

time.description: A string array of date timestamps used to filter the returned records between two dates.

filter.description: A CQL string used to filter the results

next.description: An integer that can be used to get the next page of results. Can be used in conjuction with limit to provide for pagination of results.

propertyname.description: A string array of property names that should be returned in the response

HttpResponse.description: Response object for PUT and DELETE operations

nextPageToken.description: A token to obtain the next paginated data set

id.description: unique ID, potentially link to file

ItemProperties.description: provides the core metatdata fields plus extensions

license.description: Data license name based on SPDX License List

next.description: A URL to obtain the next paginated data set. If not present, the client should utilize the `nextPageToken`.

Time.description: A single date-time string that adheres to RFC3339, for example 1985-04-12T23:20:50.52Z

TimeRange.description: begin and end timestamps adhering to RFC3339

Int64Range.description: An integer range with begin and end

DoubleRange.description: A double range with begin and end

modelClassName.description: Class name of the model that defines the extension.

method.description: The HTTP method for the endpoint

next.description: Next value to use for pagination [next=1] get page 2 with pages begin zero based.

bbox.description: The bounding box to use to query for intersecting geometries.

limit.description: The number of records to return
